prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: 061.1 [NII]
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: [NII] 205 um observation of ALESS 061.1 at z=4.419.

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: The expected line width is ~300 km/s. The 976.563 kHz resolution with 4 channel binning (~2.2 km/s) adopted here maximized the spectral coverage of the observations (thus allowing for serendipitous detections of other lines). This setup is preferred with respect to the 31.250 MHz sampling, because the latter may result in undersampling of the line if this is narrower than expected (~100 km/s or less).

The sources targeted in this study are unresolved to ~1" scale. The proposed observations aim at detecting the lines over the entire sources, without attempting any mapping experiment. Therefore, compact configurations are requested.

Our sensitivity estimates are based on the conservative assumption that the [NII] 205um line targeted here has a luminosity equal to 1e-5 times the IR luminosity, i.e., the lowest [NII]/IR ratio observed to date (see Fig.1). This corresponds to 5.7e7 Lsun for ALESS 061.1. We aim to achieve a 3-sigma detection of the line over the entire line width (fiducially assumed to be 300 km/s). At these sensitivity limits, we expect clear (>5-sigma) detections for most of the lines.

prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: 065.1 [NII]
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: [NII] 205 um observation of ALESS 065.1 at z=4.445.

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: The expected line width is ~300 km/s. The 976.563 kHz resolution with 4 channel binning (~2.2 km/s) adopted here maximized the spectral coverage of the observations (thus allowing for serendipitous detections of other lines). This setup is preferred with respect to the 31.250 MHz sampling, because the latter may result in undersampling of the line if this is narrower than expected (~100 km/s or less).

The sources targeted in this study are unresolved to ~1" scale. The proposed observations aim at detecting the lines over the entire sources, without attempting any mapping experiment. Therefore, compact configurations are requested.

Our sensitivity estimates are based on the conservative assumption that the [NII] 205um line targeted here has a luminosity equal to 1e-5 times the IR luminosity, i.e., the lowest [NII]/IR ratio observed to date (see Fig.1). This corresponds to 3.9e7 Lsun for ALESS 065.1. We aim to achieve a 3-sigma detection of the line over the entire line width (fiducially assumed to be 300 km/s). At these sensitivity limits, we expect clear (>5-sigma) detections for most of the lines.

prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: 049.1 [NII]
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: [NII] 205 um observation of ALESS 049.1 at z=2.942.

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: The expected line width is ~300 km/s. The 976.563 kHz resolution with 4 channel binning (~1.6 km/s) adopted here maximized the spectral coverage of the observations (thus allowing for serendipitous detections of other lines). This setup is preferred with respect to the 31.250 MHz sampling, because the latter may result in undersampling of the line if this is narrower than expected (~100 km/s or less).

The sources targeted in this study are unresolved to ~1" scale. The proposed observations aim at detecting the lines over the entire sources, without attempting any mapping experiment. Therefore, compact configurations are requested.

Our sensitivity estimates are based on the conservative assumption that the [NII] 205um line targeted here has a luminosity equal to 1e-5 times the IR luminosity, i.e., the lowest [NII]/IR ratio observed to date (see Fig.1). This corresponds to 7.3e7 Lsun for ALESS 049.1. We aim to achieve a 3-sigma detection of the line over the entire line width (fiducially assumed to be 300 km/s). At these sensitivity limits, we expect clear (>5-sigma) detections for most of the lines.

prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: 071.1 [NII]
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: [NII] 205 um observation of ALESS 071.1 at z=3.697.

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: The expected line width is ~300 km/s. The 976.563 kHz resolution with 4 channel binning (~1.8 km/s) adopted here maximized the spectral coverage of the observations (thus allowing for serendipitous detections of other lines). This setup is preferred with respect to the 31.250 MHz sampling, because the latter may result in undersampling of the line if this is narrower than expected (~100 km/s or less).

The sources targeted in this study are unresolved to ~1" scale. The proposed observations aim at detecting the lines over the entire sources, without attempting any mapping experiment. Therefore, compact configurations are requested.

Our sensitivity estimates are based on the conservative assumption that the [NII] 205um line targeted here has a luminosity equal to 1e-5 times the IR luminosity, i.e., the lowest [NII]/IR ratio observed to date (see Fig.1). This corresponds to 14.3e7 Lsun for ALESS 071.1. We aim to achieve a 3-sigma detection of the line over the entire line width (fiducially assumed to be 300 km/s). At these sensitivity limits, we expect clear (>5-sigma) detections for most of the lines.

prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: 076.1 [NII]
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: [NII] 205 um observation of ALESS 076.1 at z=3.389.

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: The expected line width is ~300 km/s. The 976.563 kHz resolution with 4 channel binning (~1.6 km/s) adopted here maximized the spectral coverage of the observations (thus allowing for serendipitous detections of other lines). This setup is preferred with respect to the 31.250 MHz sampling, because the latter may result in undersampling of the line if this is narrower than expected (~100 km/s or less).

The sources targeted in this study are unresolved to ~1" scale. The proposed observations aim at detecting the lines over the entire sources, without attempting any mapping experiment. Therefore, compact configurations are requested.

Our sensitivity estimates are based on the conservative assumption that the [NII] 205um line targeted here has a luminosity equal to 1e-5 times the IR luminosity, i.e., the lowest [NII]/IR ratio observed to date (see Fig.1). This corresponds to 6.8e7 Lsun for ALESS 076.1. We aim to achieve a 3-sigma detection of the line over the entire line width (fiducially assumed to be 300 km/s). At these sensitivity limits, we expect clear (>5-sigma) detections for most of the lines.

prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: 049.1 [CII]
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: [CII] 158 um observation of ALESS 049.1 at z=2.942.

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: The expected line width is ~300 km/s. The 976.563 kHz resolution with 4 channel binning (~1.2 km/s) adopted here maximized the spectral coverage of the observations (thus allowing for serendipitous detections of other lines). This setup is preferred with respect to the 31.250 MHz sampling, because the latter may result in undersampling of the line if this is narrower than expected (~100 km/s or less).

The sources targeted in this study are unresolved to ~1" scale. The proposed observations aim at detecting the lines over the entire sources, without attempting any mapping experiment. Therefore, compact configurations are requested.

Our sensitivity estimates for [CII] are based on the conservative assumption that the [CII] 158um line targeted here has a luminosity equal to 2e-4 times the IR luminosity, i.e., the lowest [CII]/IR ratio observed to date. This corresponds to 1.5e9 Lsun for ALESS 049.1. We aim to achieve a secure 10-sigma detection of the line over the entire line width (fiducially assumed to be 300 km/s). The high significance is required since the sources may be marginally resolved at ~0.7" resolution. The proposed sensitivity can be achieved with only a few minutes of integration with ALMA.

prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: 071.1 [CII]
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: [CII] 158 um observation of ALESS 071.1 at z=3.697.

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: The expected line width is ~300 km/s. The 976.563 kHz resolution with 4 channel binning (~1.4 km/s) resolution adopted here maximized the spectral coverage of the observations (thus allowing for serendipitous detections of other lines). This setup is preferred with respect to the 31.250 MHz sampling, because the latter may result in undersampling of the line if this is narrower than expected (~100 km/s or less).

The sources targeted in this study are unresolved to ~1" scale. The proposed observations aim at detecting the lines over the entire sources, without attempting any mapping experiment. Therefore, compact configurations are requested.

Our sensitivity estimates for [CII] are based on the conservative assumption that the [CII] 158um line targeted here has a luminosity equal to 2e-4 times the IR luminosity, i.e., the lowest [CII]/IR ratio observed to date. This corresponds to 2.9e9 Lsun for ALESS 071.1. We aim to achieve a secure 10-sigma detection of the line over the entire line width (fiducially assumed to be 300 km/s). The high significance is required since the sources may be marginally resolved at ~0.7" resolution. The proposed sensitivity can be achieved in less than 2 minutes of integration with ALMA. Since the observations are dominated by overheads, we set the sensitivity request to the equivalent of 5 min of integration on source.

prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: 076.1 [CII]
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: [CII] 158 um observation of ALESS 076.1 at z=3.389.

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: The expected line width is ~300 km/s. The 976.563 kHz resolution with 4 channel rebinning (~1.4 km/s) adopted here maximized the spectral coverage of the observations (thus allowing for serendipitous detections of other lines). This setup is preferred with respect to the 31.250 MHz sampling, because the latter may result in undersampling of the line if this is narrower than expected (~100 km/s or less).

The sources targeted in this study are unresolved to ~1" scale. The proposed observations aim at detecting the lines over the entire sources, without attempting any mapping experiment. Therefore, compact configurations are requested.

Our sensitivity estimates for [CII] are based on the conservative assumption that the [CII] 158um line targeted here has a luminosity equal to 2e-4 times the IR luminosity, i.e., the lowest [CII]/IR ratio observed to date. This corresponds to 1.4e9 Lsun for ALESS 076.1. We aim to achieve a secure 10-sigma detection of the line over the entire line width (fiducially assumed to be 300 km/s). The high significance is required since the sources may be marginally resolved at ~0.7" resolution. The proposed sensitivity can be achieved with only a few minutes of integration with ALMA.

prp:ObsProposal.prp:abstract: Fine structure lines are unique probes of the physical conditions of the interstellar medium (ISM), especially at high redshift where traditional diagnostics (based on rest-frame optical lines) are not available. The [NII] 205um line traces the ionized phase of the ISM, invested by intense UV radiation from newborn massive stars. Compared with other lines (e.g., [OIII]), it has a lower rest frequency, thus enabling its observations at (sub-)mm wavelengths over a wider range of redshifts. We recently concluded the first [NII] 205um survey in a small sample of high-z galaxies, pushing the IRAM Plateau de Bure Interferometer to its limits. Here we propose to capitalize on the unparalleled sensitivity offered by ALMA in order to search for [NII] and complementary [CII] emission in all IR-bright high-z galaxies selected from the ALESS survey, an unbiased sample of IR-bright galaxies with rich ancillary information at virtually any wavelengths. Out of the ~120 ALESS galaxies, we focus on 5 galaxies with secure spectroscopic redshifts z>2.9, so that the [NII] 205um line falls in ALMA bands 6-7. The proposed observations will pave the way for studies of the ISM physics at high redshift.
prp:ObsProposal.prp:scientificCategoryString: Cosmology and the High Redshift Universe
